Sequence Information.Peptide Name: mSAA2 (mouse serum amyloid A isoform 2, antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; rodents, mammals; animals; BBMm)

Literature.Author: Zheng H, Li H, Zhang J, et al. 2019
Literature.Title: Serum amyloid A exhibits pH dependent antibacterial action and contributes to host defense against Staphylococcus aureus cutaneous infection

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (82.5%) tomSAA1.  Earlier, it was noticed that expression of this protein in cell lines can reduce the growth of E. coli (BMC gastroenterology10, 133, Nov 2010).Activity:  Active against E. coli and S. aureus at acidic pH 5.5.  An incubation with 2.5 uM peptide reduced bacteria by 90%. Deletion of SAA1/2 in mice impaired the clearance of S. aureus in the skin. The bacterial killing of SAA at acidic pH was achieved via membrane binding and disruption (Zheng et al., 2019).
